bibl.title: Antinoopolis. The Area of St. Colluthos in the North Necropolis.
bibl.note: 1. General outline of the development of the Colluthos martyrium. - 2. The church proper. - 3. The south-eastern rooms 1-4. - 4. Room no. 5. - 5. The western enlargement of the area C1 and the rooms 6-8 and 9. - 6. Considerations on the original and later shrines of St. Colluthos. - 7. On the choice of a new Colluthos shrine in the area C1 of the North necropolis. - 8. The procedure of incubation in the shrine of St. Colluthos. - 9. The sanctuary as a Christian oracle centre of St. Colluthos.
bibl.seg: Peter Grossmann, Antinoopolis. The Area of St. Colluthos in the North Necropolis.
Rosario Pintaudi (ed.), Antinoupolis. II. Scavi e materiali = Edizioni dell'Istituto Papirologico ""G. Vitelli"". 3 (Firenze, 2014) pp. 241-300, 17 pll. n./bl. et coul., 4 figg.

1. General outline of the development of the Colluthos martyrium. - 2. The church proper. - 3. The south-eastern rooms 1-4. - 4. Room no. 5. - 5. The western enlargement of the area C1 and the rooms 6-8 and 9. - 6. Considerations on the original and later shrines of St. Colluthos. - 7. On the choice of a new Colluthos shrine in the area C1 of the North necropolis. - 8. The procedure of incubation in the shrine of St. Colluthos. - 9. The sanctuary as a Christian oracle centre of St. Colluthos.
